Reviews.Title: “No thanks!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMan72
Reviews.Content: Turkish Airlines put us up here in a day room between flights. The room was not available on arrival and breakfast was poor and horrible! and when we got the room, it was stinking of old stale cigarette smoke even though it was a no-smoking room. It was not properly cleaned (former guests underwear in the closet!!!). The room was also tiny and beds uncomfortable. The staff was not friendly and the reception was a bit rude. 4 Stars?, NO: far from it and we would never choose this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet February'Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brieuc-Yves
Reviews.Content: In February Grand Yavuz Hotel is definitively a quiet and great experience. Quiet because there are no noise at all in the neighborhood. Great because the staf is helpful, the accommodation is nice, the breakfast is enjoyable and last but not least, the hotel is so well situated in the Pierre Loti (they write it Piyer...) 'caddesi' or 'street' a 15 mn walk away from the Blue Mosque and from the Aya Sofia Mosque. And the chamber's prices are nice. Because of this all it really earns a good 3 stars mention (not 4).

Reviews.Title: “decent place”
Reviews.Author: Creatinka
Reviews.Content: I liked the place. It is clean; rooms are of o'k size, housekeeping is efficient. It is located on very quiet street - but Blue Mosque is hardly 10 minutes walk!!! breakfast was good. thank you, Turkish airlines and Grand Yavuz for splendid stopover in Istanbul!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star?”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang S
Reviews.Content: I like to know how Hotels in Turkey earn their stars. The Yavuz has nice public areas, and a reasonably accommodating staff, but thats were it ends. The rooms are small and very outdated. The bathrooms are even smaller and not nice. There is a mini bar and room service, but no place to sit down to eat or drink. The mattresses are rock hard (not firm, hard) and bedding, pillows and towels are old and worn. The location is ok at best. It is in a seedy but apparently safe part of town. The usual tourist attractions are in walking distance if you don't mind climbing a steep hill before getting to the Grand Bazar area. At best this would be a three star hotel, but I have stayed at nicer places with two stars.

Reviews.Title: “grand yavuz a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jimbohoho
Reviews.Content: great hotel the staff were excellent very friendly and helpful spoke good english the hotel is about half way down hill between Divanyolu cadessi and the coast the marmaris sea, the room we had ''402'' was roomy no squeezing around the bed's the room looked just as in the hotel photos it was comfortable the was bedding changed each day but the room could do with some drawer space as there is only one in the desk and one between the beds.The breakfast was the usual buffet style no problems there, the meal we had in the roof top restraunt was very good,the only real problem was no food or drink was allowed from outside and there was no kettle in the room '' we have small travel kettle for just these occasions'' if you do the same just dont make it obvious what you are doing, if you need tea coffe milk and water there are plenty of small shops and supermarkets within five minuets walk of the hotel.If you dont fancy staying in for a meal in the evening there are some very nice restraunts one or two minutes up hill on Pierre Loti cadessi or you can just as easily walk up to Divanyolu and try any of the many restraunts in nearby Sultanhamnet. just down hill there is a small local park which is very nice in the evening with a very nice bakers close by for fresh bread in the morning if you are going to have a picnic later in the day

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oztraveller64
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights in this place I couldn't wait to leave. We had to move rooms after the first night for maintenance and went to an even worse room. No air-conditioning through the day which frankly is unacceptable. Very little information was given about the hotel services and whilst breakfast was ok, it was the same every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not a real 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maicol_Cris
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is quite nasty, it seems that you are annoying them. Medium standard rooms, so not a real 4 stars hotel! They don't do the cleaning up of the room, in fact we used two glasses and they didn't change or wash them, just put them in order. You can't drink or eat in the room, even tough you buy something from the minibar. The position of the hotel is central, but not very accessible. We think that there are many other hotels in better position and, above all, in better conditions! We also tried the Sokullu Pasa Hotel, which is definitely better!

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: SammoEastGosford
Reviews.Content: Grand Yavuz is in old Istanbul, 1km walk to Grand Bazaar. Hotel very clean, staff efficient but could speak better english. Rooms small but ok. Breakfast ample and included.

Reviews.Title: “Small room in a not that good location”
Reviews.Author: macxwell
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are quite small. You can barely move around the three sides of the bed. And if you have more than one trolley for luggage you're going to find it difficult to store your stuff. The bathroom is just large enough for one person to move around. And you get half a bath tub, which is sufficient to move around when you use the shower. But the shower is made with Turks in mind. A tall European or a big American will have difficulties showering comfortably. The hotel is located downhill from the old city. (a 15 min. walk) Not something all the tourist in the hotel were apparently able to cope with. All in all, the price of this hotel is too high for what is offers. You can find better deals in better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, good location, would go there again.”
Reviews.Author: rainman96
Reviews.Content: To start with a disclaimer: we were upgraded to a very very nice suite, so I cannot really say anything about the value-for-money aspects and about the 'normal' rooms in the hotel. The Grand Yavuz hotel is located right in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul and has public transport and important sightseeing destinations like the Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia within walking distance. As seems to be characteristic for Istanbul, the hotel is in the middle of a mixed residential/commercial area which may seem uninviting at first sight, but turns out to be friendly and open. The staff of the hotel is very friendly and service oriented, the hotel is very clean and the interior (and exterior) is comfortable, luxurious and well-maintained. Apart from some of the housekeeping staff all employees speak English, way better than our grasp of the Turkish language. The suite we were staying in (we normally just have a double room wherever we go) was very big, very clean and we could not find any fault with it. Even though it was the end of October, the temperatures in the room went up considerably by the end of the afternoon and the air conditioning in the room was definitely not a luxury. We did not actually have lunch or dinner at the hotel, but breakfast at restaurant on the subterranean level and drinks at the bar on the top level of the building were nice. Prices for food and drinks were very reasonable, even items from the minibar were very reasonably priced. To summarise: we had a very nice stay at the Grand Yavuz hotel and would definitely consider visiting it again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: madhair
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel , it's in a wonderful location and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Istanbul is the most incredible destination and you'd be mad not to go !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamirFarig
Reviews.Content: Dear Hussein and all the reception team of grand Yavuz hotel I would like to thank you for the nice hospitality and really it was very nice vacation with my friends from Palestine and morocco â€“ Room 501 and 502 since 22/8 till 28/8 . We spent a good time and really it was very nice hotel that very close to the most favor places of Istanbul . Thanks again and really I will plan all my visits to Istanbul at your hotel . Samir Farig HP

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room, bad staff”
Reviews.Author: lucasousa
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is not a 4 star. It's a solid 3 star hotel. First the pros: good location. You can go up the street and in 5 minutes you'll get to Ã‡emberlitas tram satation (and Grand bazar) or you can go in 5-10 minutes walk to main places like the hipodromum, the blue mosque and Hagia Sophia. The rooms are average, no problem with that. Not very big, but confortable and clean. Breakfast was also average. The bad: I didn't like the staff. I wasn't pleasant with the lack of simpathy from them. Every question I asked was always answered without no smile, without no help. We were given a twin room with two beds far away from each other and separated by furniture. I asked if I could change to a double room and I was told to put the beds together myself. So me and my girlfriend had to charge the desk (wich was heavy) to a corner of the room, which for me is not acceptable in a 4 star hotel. But for me that wasn't a big issue. The worst for me was when I asked if they could give me a map. The answer was: "5 Turkish lira". I've never been to a hotel which charged for simple map. We declined to pay that money, went to dinner to the restaurant next door, and they gave us a free map. The hotel is good, but they made a bad impression on me. So I think the good reviews are correct but don't expect much from the staff. But it's a good starting point to see Istanbul. And what a great city Istanbul is!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Nice Hotel! maybe the place not so nice...”
Reviews.Author: Bugianen78
Reviews.Content: I liked this Hotel very much! It was very cleaned, the service, reception and porter were good and ecellent! The only point is the position. It's quite closed to the very city center.... but placed in a distance with a long lift... Breakfast super! Anyway, I would like to come back again and I suggest this hotel to everybody. There is not an italian program on TV. Suggestion: in front of the hotel there is a internet point for only 1 Lira at hour...

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL IN AN EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: istanbultraveller21
Reviews.Content: Weve been to many different hotels in Istanbul , and this was seriously the BEST one we have stayed at . Upon arriving , we were stood outside before checking in , and the staff came out to us and took in our cases for us . Swift check in also , with eletric keys . Upon arriving in our room , we were amazed . The room was MASSIVE , so so clean , had a flat screen TV and the beds were so comfortable . Also there is a shower / bath combination . The shower was so incredible , i never wanted to get out , was so relaxing lol . All the staff were so friendly , really made an effort to make sure our stay was the best experience . At breakfast there is a HUGE selection , ok you have to pay for orange juice , but you do get compimentary tea / coffee . There is a wide range of food at the buffet . Also the hotel has its own roof top restaurant , we didnt eat here but we went to look , and it looked soooo nice . Also there is the health club which does Turkish Bath's . We were going to have one but didnt have time . Prices started from 15 euro . Food and drink is not allowed into the hotel from outside , but trust me , the breakfast makes up for that . The breakfasts were incredible . Also , before going to the hotel , we emailed the hotel to confirm our reservation . They quickly replied confirming our stay and asked if we need transportation to and from the airport . We didnt use the transportation as we already had a taxi booked . Also , we had wifi in our rooms which was GREAT ! OVERALL , a GREAT hotel , just 2 or 3 minutes away from all the sites . Fantastic value , friendly staff , fantastic rooms . CANNOT WAIT TO GO BACK ! SERIOUSLY , go and stay here and experience it for yourself , trust me !

Reviews.Title: “A place to recommend”
Reviews.Author: taneraslanoglu
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a group of six couples at the Grand Yavuz for four nights. The hotel is very well managed and has a high level of professionality. I missed fresh fruit at breakfast, but otherwise things were fine.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JeannieB62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week during November 2009 booked through Jules Verne. Other members of the tour group I travelled with fared better insomuch as their hotels were in a much nicer part of Sultanahmet. My main concern was the poor, very badly lit area that this hotel is situated. As I was a lone female traveller this was of some concern, especially when returning to the hotel at night! Although the entrance, lounge and general rooms downstairs were fine, I found my bedroom to be tired looking, with a bathroom that did not have any plugs and a toilet that you had to squeeze round from an overlarge sink. As I suffer with a bad back I eventually got a plug so I could have a bath, but the plug didn't fit so I gave up! As far as toileteries were concerned, there was only one bottle of watery shampoo available. Hardly luxurious. There was also no evidence that my room was hoovered during the week I stayed there. Breakfast was also very disappointing, with only the cheapest and nastiest of cereals, absolutely no fresh fruit and lack of choice. Okay if you like eating meat for breakfast, I do not! It's a shame that with a bit more of an effort this hotel would be a true 4 star hotel, but, at the moment it certainly is not, more 3 star. I loved Istanbul and would certainly return again, but certainly not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump.”
Reviews.Author: cattypas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 (too lengthy) nights as part of a pre-arranged package trip to Greece and Istanbul. The staff at the hotel can barely speak English, and are probably the most unhelpful and rude hotel staff I've encountered in at least a decade (and I've traveled a lot). They cater to big international tour groups and seem to be able to get by with providing absolutely minimal service to all. Plus, in this hypercongested neighborhood, this adds noisy, giant diesel-spewing fumes to all the rooms, 24/7. The hotel staff refused to make a local call for us to make a dinner reservation (told us to call from our room instead) and refused to change a 50 TL note (approx. $30). The room itself was extremely small, bathroom was literally falling apart, sheets had suspicious stains, and towels threadbare. Plus, guests need to be no wider than a supermodel to fit into the toilet "alcove". Extremely tiny TV. Breakfast buffet included several suspicious-looking "fruit drinks" that were definitely not the real thing. The only day they had fresh fruit out for breakfast, they were literally following guests who'd taken a pc. of fruit to badger them to pay extra! For this place to represent itself as a 4 Star Hotel is a total farce. If you're familiar with the BBC's Fawlty Towers, this hotel makes Basil Fawlty seem like a real prince.

Reviews.Title: “suitable to our needs”
Reviews.Author: Ester007
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at Grand Yavuz for 4 days on business. We were very satisfied with the friendly, helpful and efficient staff. The hotel has an ideal location as it is directly in the city centre. The rooms are spacious and regularly cleaned, there is wi-fi available. We had a chance to eat breakfast, coffe breaks and lunches at the hotel which were all to our complete satisfaction. I can sincerely recommend the hotel to all the tourists, business travellers or even families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: ULDB65
Reviews.Content: I booked 14 rooms for 2 nights, then returned a week later for 2 more nights with the same group. Check in was super friendly and efficient, with the bellmen running to grab luggage from our bus, and the Mehtap (who also handled my booking via email and was always responsive and helpful) at the front desk had all the room keys ready and organized. The lobby and public spaces were nicer than I expected, and restaurant and bar staff attentive and efficient. Rooms were small, as is typical European standard, but clean, and most with excellent views of the city and sea, and some with balconies. The location is excellent, a few short blocks uphill to the mosques and bazaars, and a few short blocks downhill to the waterfront, fish market and more shopping. The Turkish bath is excellent (many compliments to Mustafa) according to the 9 people that tried it the first week, and scheduled return visits for the 2nd week..Of the 28 people in my group, not a single complaint about the hotel, and lots of kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor choices”
Reviews.Author: kostantinosLarisa
Reviews.Content: Not a clean hotel , terrible staff , the only advantage that has the hotel is that is in Sultanahmet ,so you can see historical centre of istanbul on feet.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: youngeel
Reviews.Content: The Grand Yavuz Hotel has nice rooms. Nothing fancy but very nice. The rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful. Because I booked through the Internet I received a free visit to the Turkish bath. This is not to be missed. It was relaxing and quite an experience. The breakfast each morning was good with ample variety available.

Reviews.Title: “We were really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jenovoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Yavuz on 3 different occasion over a couple of weeks while travelling in Turkey - we were not part of a tour group. We arrive exhausted after travelling for 28 hours and we were not able to book in early (we were in Europe for 7 weeks and this is the only hotel that made us wait 2 hours in the lobby until it was checking in time (we only arrived early because of our flights). The first room was terrible, small and right over the main entrance to the hotel. It was constantly noisy. The room was small though clean enough but the bath leaked so the floor was always wet. The room for our second stay was a little better just further along the corridor but at least the bath didn't leak. The room for our 3rd stay was along the same corridor was bigger and a lot more comfortable and not noisy. We booked 9 months in advance through a travel agent so I don't know what it takes to get a room with a view. The hotel is at the bottom of a steep hill which you have to climb if you want to see the attractions. If we had know more of what is available in Istanbul, as we do now, we would not have stayed the second or third time. The staff (except for the first guy on the front desk that first day) were really nice and helpful. The view from the restaurant was good. We will be going back to Istanbul but we will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Nice Staff..........but watch the taxi's!”
Reviews.Author: consan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Easter weekend and had a lovely time at the hotel. We were due to stay in Hotel Artefes but they cancelled our bookking last minute so we found Grand Yavuz through Venere. It's not in a super neighbourhood but it was perfectly quiet and safe whilst we were there. It's a 10 min walk to Blue Mosque or tram (with hills) but we didn't find this a hassle at all. the staff were friendly and informative except for one guy who recommended a restaurant in the seafood area ( they collect u and drop u back). It wasn't good at all and we told him not to be handing out brochures for sub-standard restaurants. Too many other super restaurants to go to!! Our rooms were lovely, with a terrace, fridge, Tv, spacious bathroom etc. The breakfast was buffet style and enough there to keep us interested for the 4 days. It's a pity it's not on the 7th floor though where the bar / restaurant is as the views are lovely. Overall the hotel is lovely if not lacking in charachter ( could have been 4* star hotel in any city). The only gripe with had with Istanbul was the taxi's - our 1st trip from the harbour to the hotel cost us 10 times what it should have and all the taxi's on the rank were in on it as we asked them the price in advance and insisted they use a meter. We still got caught!! It should cost 4TRY and cost us 40TRY!! And he tried to pretend I didn't give him a 50 note just a 5note - thief! All taxi's should use 'tarif 1' on their metre until midnight and it's very cheap to use them but INSIST on tarif 1 or they will rob you ( ALL of them).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite”
Reviews.Author: ejder
Reviews.Content: In July 2008, as a tourist, I stayed in one of single rooms. From its window, I could see beautiful scenery of blue colored sea of Marmara that made me happy every morning during my stay. And further, all of the hotel staffs I met were welcoming and friendly. Especially I remember that some of the staffs explained me gently how to get to suburb bus terminal or to one of rather unknown mosques whenever I asked the way. The level of room amenity, and services such as laundry service, shuttle bus service to international airport, restaurant had no problems, being gratifying. As you can see in this hotelâ€™s homepage explanations, from this hotel, I could easily get to various kinds of famous historical places, such as Blue mosque, Hagia-Sophia museum, Topkapi palace, Grand Bazaar, etc. (Adding to that, around the hotel, you can find some local stores in which Turkish products for daily use, foods, beverage can be obtained. That kinds of shopping brings us a lot of touristic fun too, I think.) I think that Grand Yavuz Hotel is suitable to tourists who want to fully enjoy his/her summer vacation in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We probably got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: lordreid
Reviews.Content: Had it been only my wife and me -- and not a tour group -- arriving at the Grand Yavuz, we'd have had serious concerns. The neighborhood is dingy by our standards, but we came to find the area very interesting. The view over the rooftops from the hotel restaurant/bar confirms that impression of the neighborhood, but the presence of so many satellite dishes tells you it's heavily residential. Our room was compact, at best, and had poor A/C. We were told the A/C was withheld until 6 pm, but even then the fan was weak and the effect as weak. We slept with an open window. The staff was young and friendly and spoke enough English to accommodate us. The walk to the Sultanamet area was not bad, although it was steadily uphill. The staff of nearby restaurants were delightful, making us feel welcome and adding to our emjoyment of the neighborhood so different from our own. I still marvel at the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and the Bosphorus tour. Istanbul was just a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the Grand Yavuz Hotel and expect anywhere near 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Lizzylazyway
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a four day trip to Istanbul. We stayed at the Grand Yavuz and was disappointed with the rooms. They were extremely small, the beds were very uncomfortable, the bed covers smelled of stale greasy hair, the bathroom was barely big enough to go into and the bath (over which there was a shower) was actually half the length of a normal bath as a normal bath would not have fitted into the room, the pillows were cheap and uncomfortable, the air con did not perform well enough and therefore the room was stuffy. We could not have the windows open for the night as there was continual noise outside the room from youths who just hung around in the small triangle on the corner of the road the hotel was on. I rang down on the third night as we had had very little sleep over the other nights through the temperature of the room. The Receptionist said they would deal with the laughing and joking at 2am in the morning, we waited 15 minutes and nothing happened, I then went down personally to the reception as even with the windows closed (double glazed too) we could hear them clearly. The Receptionist again said that he would deal with it. However, nothing was done and it wasn't until after 3am that the "gang" finally went away of their own accord. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone at all. Apart from that, Istanbul was brilliant and would indeed recommend a visit - just don't be fooled by the 4 star ratings, they clearly do not come near to 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not as it seems”
Reviews.Author: paulharris1969
Reviews.Content: On arrival after an hours drive from the airport, we felt slightly let down from the description of what we had seen online. The hotel is located in what i would call a "run down" area of the city. Although the hotel looks nice from the reception entrance, the hotel pictures do not show the surrounding area. The rooftop bar is acceptable, but the view in the day time is a bit of a let down, at night at least the ships lights in the bosphurus is slightly better to look at. On arrival we were advised not to travel further than 10 miles away from the hotel for our own safety. We were also told that a taxi would not take us any further than that distance or pick us up. This alarmed us to say the least. The only saving grace of our 3 day trip was the outing to the grand bazaar, which is an incredible experience. There were no bars, only restaurants.Food was mainly seafood. Was not expecting 5 WTL (Â£2.50) per half pint of lager in the hotel, and everywhere else! Hotel food was great (if you like olives). The blue mosque was an amazing sight to see at night when illuminated. Too many aggressive sellers, from the people who try to get you into their restaurants to the fragrance sellers and everything else! And we paid 125 euros per night for a room accomodating three people. I wouldn't choose to go to Istanbul again. Very steep and cobbled sstreets, not recommended for elderly or disabled.

Reviews.Title: “Not good!!!”
Reviews.Author: ClauMex
Reviews.Content: We stay there just 1 night, and it was enought for us, we were not happy with the service. When we arrived I called to the front desk to ask the prices for phone calls, I spoke with 2 people, they did not speak good english and they said that they do not know the price per minute, but could be arround 1 euro per minute. So I call to MÃ©xico 8 min and next day in my check out they gave me the bill and I had to ask for the phone call charge because it was not on the bill, after some minutes, they took a report and charged me 66USD for it!!!!! I was in shock and ask why it is was so expensive, and they never answer something correctly, just said because of the system, the lady in the front desk was very rude, and when I was trying to speak, she was screening in order to does not listen me, she must not work there, because I work in a hotel in Playa del Carmen, MÃ©xico and I am front desk staff and is she works with me, she must be kind and educated the other wise she will not work with me. Anyway I did not have good experience with the service, and the staff was not good, also I saw how she spoke at the same time with other guests and this is not the service that we deserved as a guests.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT grand”
Reviews.Author: mpet123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Grand" Yavuz Hotel for 5 nights in August 2008. We (myself, my wife and two children, 8 and 3 years old) were put up in a so called "family" room that consisted of a double bed and a separate single bed. Although the room itself was sufficiently clean, we encountered numerous problems. For a family of four, only two bath towels were provided. I had to contact the reception twice everyday to ask them to provide more. There were stains on the duvet as well as on the hand towels. The airconditioning worked for only a few hours (or probably minutes) everyday. This was the middle of summer in Istanbul, when the temperatures easily reached mid 30s and was extremely humid. I found myself waking up every night sweating. When I asked the reception about the poor airconditioning, this is the reply I got - it has something to do with the central heating, which gets hot shutting off the airconditioning system till it gets cooler. I didn't get it, if someone else did, please let me know. But the thing that I consider inexcusable, is their extremely poor room service. My 3 year old son drinks a glass of warm milk everynight before sleeping. The first time we asked room service for warm milk, they took an hour to bring it to us, complaining of being very busy. My son was already asleep by then. The next day, the same thing happened, and my wife had to personally go down to the restaurant to get some milk. Towards the end of our stay, they did manage to get the milk to us, with just a little delay of 20 minutes. I wish I could write something nice, but there is nothing to recommend in this hotel. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is close to the main tourist sites, but it sits at the bottom of a hill, and there is a steep climb involved to get out of the area. The reception staff are a bit cold and could do with smiling occasionally and being a bit more friendly. They charge 10 euros or 20 Turkish lira to use the safe in the room (although 5 euros is refunded at the end of your stay). The breakfast menu doesnot change at all. The cold milk on offer with the cereals seems more like cold water with a little milk added in. The juices (only 2 types) were bland and warm. You had to pay for fresh juices. All in all, we were pretty glad to leave the hotel at the end of our vacation. It didn't stop us from having a great time in Istanbul, but a better hotel to relax in at the end of the day would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, Horrible location”
Reviews.Author: JAGR32
Reviews.Content: Rooms were average European size (small by American standards) and the beds were extremely hard. The buffet breakfast was OK but not great and didn't change the whole time we were there. PROS - The hotel was pretty and the staff very helpful. The hamam (Turkish bath) was nice and enjoyable. CONS - The "free internet access" was a joke. Could only get the internet by sitting in the lobby. The location was HORRIBLE!!! Although it looks close to everything on the map, it's actually at the bottom of a very steep hill that we had to climb every day just to get to the main sights. It was such a trek that we stayed out all day and only came back when we had to. Also, it's frequented by Dutch and German tour groups so the price wasn't cheap. if you want to stay in Sultanamet, you're better off staying at a hotel near Divanyolu Cadessi (where the tram line is) or Akbiyik Cadessi, near the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: UKSheffieldlass
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights Feb 2008. The staff were very friendly and efficient. The room was small and very noisy - we could hear everything from the room next door, including every time the bathroom was used. The bar area is very pleasant. The restaurant has great views but the food is of the fast food variety - not fine dining. The breakfasts were adequate, but you pay extra for fresh fruit juice and there was no fresh fruit available to eat. A good base as not too far from Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Yavuz Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piyerloti Caddesi No: 71/B | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34126, Turkey
